summary: This is a Daily Activity Report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for July 15, 2019. It details routine prison operations, staff shortages, equipment issues, and inmate population counts. The report was created the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found injured in his cell, but does not mention that specific incident.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The reporting officer who compiled the daily activity information for the Morning, Day, and Evening Watch shifts.

persons.name: Correctional Officer
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a staff shortage on the Day Watch shift.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations
events.description: Routine operations at MCC New York, including staff shortages, a broken sprinkler head, missing reports, and standard inmate population counts.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This routine administrative report is dated July 16, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found injured in his cell on July 15, 2019.
The report notes 'no significant incidents occurred' on the Morning and Evening Watch shifts, but the Day Watch shift had a staff shortage.
The total inmate population at MCC New York at the beginning of the shift on July 15, 2019, was 798.
The document lists various administrative issues like missing fire/security reports and equipment inventory forms.
The report's lack of mention of the high-profile incident involving Jeffrey Epstein is notable given its date and location.
